miic.core.inversion.quantify_vchange_drop¶

quantify_vchange_drop(vc_curve, time_win_len)[source]¶

Rolling interval (instead of point) derivative

For each t0 it calculates the simple (x_t1 - x_t2) where t0 spans the whole timeserie vc_curve and x_t1 and x_t2 are its average on two time windows of length time_win_len symmetric respect to t0. At the border the time series is reflected so that any long term trend should not be altered.

Parameters:
  • vc_curve (ndarray) – The velocity change curve (when 2D one timeseries on each column)
  • time_win_len (int) – Time window length (on each side)
  • vdrop – Velocity change point drop on the chosen time basis (2*timw_win_len days)
Return type:

ndarray
